page.title: 02Industry in Presteigne.
page.content: There are several factories in Presteigne:one where large{plastic {moulds}are made,another making{ {circuit boards},a third making{plastic {letters,}but the largest is Kaye's Presteigne Ltd. Here they make pressure and gravity{die castings}made from aluminium and zinc.The number made every day varies from 2000 to 4000.The factory employs over one hundred people,some working nights.The majority work a 39hr.week and have five weeks holiday a year. The castings are sent mainly to the Midlands by lorry and some go abroad.Any waste is remelted in the foundry.The factory is owned by Maurice Ashby of Colchester and is part of a bigger firm.Computers are used for stock control,wages and measuring castings.
